alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 9:47PM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue until there is a major breakup of the ice jam. * WHERE...River Raisin At Monroe City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:26 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of around 12.0 feet until the ice jam breaks. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Impact...Homes, businesses and roads near the River Raisin will continue to be flooded. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
